timeline.message:
[Swift5] Fix Datetime default value

If a default value is provided by the API spec for a date-time attribute,
this commit fixes the generation code to build a correct Swift `Date` object.

timeline.bodyText: @Allezxandre looks like many parameters are default to nil. Is that expected?
timeline.author: wing328

replies.bodyText: This is not related to this PR, it was introduced in another one, but apparently the samples were outdated.
replies.author: 4brunu

replies.bodyText: I actually tested with the master but didn't get these nil default value. Maybe my test wasn't done right.
replies.author: wing328

replies.bodyText: When I run ./mvnw package && ./bin/generate-samples.sh bin/configs/other/swift5-* on the master, I get all of those nil changes
replies.author: 4brunu

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for confirming that.
Is the nil default value expected? If not, we can remove it later in another PR. ( I think I know where to fix it )
replies.author: wing328

replies.bodyText:
Yes it is expected.
Basically this is just providing default nil values for for nullable types to shorten the constructor to the library user.
replies.author: 4brunu
